Tucked away in the bustling Fernvale hawker center, Lala Story offers a dining experience thatâ€™s worth a visit. The setting is quintessential hawker styleâ€”casual and lively, though a bit warm. If they could just turn up the cooling fan, it would be absolutely perfect.

Food-wise, itâ€™s a mixed bag but generally above average. Some dishes hit the mark, while others leave a bit to be desired.  The broth is really a plus and the condiments are a standout.  .Thereâ€™s not much more to say, but the key takeaway is that Iâ€™d definitely come back, especially on a cooler day when the heat isnâ€™t as much of a factor.

Second visit to Lala story with my family, we like the broth with flavorful mix of savory, fresh ingredients and the homemade chili!
Overall, this was an incredibly enjoyable meal, perfect for family or friends gatherings. If youâ€™re a fan of hot pot, Iâ€™d highly recommend this place for its flavorful broth, and fresh ingredients. Iâ€™ll definitely be back!!
First try with my family and we love it! The soup is not too salty and can taste the freshness of the lala. The homemade chili is dope! Will definitely visit again!
We traveled all the way from the west to try this newly opened Claypot stall, and it was worth it! The broth was rich and flavorful, and the ingredients were incredibly fresh. Highly recommend!

Newly opened tasty Lala hotpot for this cold weather. Plump and juicy Lala with flavorful soup base which you can add on the soup for free. Chili was spicy and ShIOK. Ingredients were fresh and price was reasonable. The charcoal was still burning even when we finish our meal. Our comfort food. A place not to be miss. Will be back soon. ğŸ‘ğŸ»ğŸ‘ğŸ»ğŸ‘ğŸ»
